value:
Ashunera, the Dawn Goddess. That is
the name given to me by the people.
I would like to be called that again.

Lehran is gentle-hearted and wise...
Taking that to heart, I choose to place
my faith in mortal beings once more.

Beings growing without guidance will
only bring chaos and turmoil to the
world. Thus I must pass judgment.

The children of flesh will never learn.
Time may pass as it always does, but
nothing alters the nature of mortals.

The children of this world are born
of chaos. I will suffer no such thing
in my world.

I hope you, too, seek order, as
$Nf does.

I am perfect. I am free of emotion,
so I have no doubts. And therefore
I commit no errors.

You will know my judgment. You will
pay for your sins.

You expect me to reverse my
judgment? The goddess of order
cannot be so...mercurial.

I do not reject the gifts of mortals.
This, too, is the duty of a goddess.

Child of another world, I am Ashera...
If you seek order and balance, I vow
to apply my judgment fairly.

What are you thinking, child of
another world?$k$pFacing endless battle, strife, and
disorder... And what kind of world
awaits you at the end of it all?$k$pOrder cannot be born from disparity
between the children of the world...$k$pProsperity for some and oppression
for others... It is unacceptable.$k$pBuild a world of peace, order, and
equality. That is the world that named
me Ashunera, the Dawn Goddess.$k$pIf you choose a different direction,
you know my judgment. All will pay
for their sins, everyone, to the last.
はっ
Simpleminded fool...
うぅ…
No...
Don't waste your energy.
Perish, flawed one.
My final judgment.
Simply an end.
My end?
Hmm...
I am...restraint. Order. Stability. History. Resolution. I am Ashera.
All this pointless flailing...I need no further evidence of your kind's imperfections.
It is inevitable. The start, as it should start. The end, as it should end.
Yune has faith in people. She is an imperfection in my being.
Yune and I were once a single being...
Ashunera, the Dawn Goddess...The name your ancestors gave me so long ago.
Tell me. Do you believe that people can change?
Yes.
There is but one future.
I am the answer.
